title: Marital infidelity is the biggest taboo of our permissive age
text:
I was on the Tube this week marvelling at the sheer number of hipster-types sporting wedding rings. I’ve also noticed them glinting with incongruity from the hands of raggedy scholars at the British library studying obscure post-modernist gender theorists, and from the ring fingers of a surprising number of comfortably-bearded bartenders in East or South-East London, whom one might have imaged would be far too cool to sign up to a life pledged in solemn matrimony.
